title: Understanding Common Car Dealership Fees and How to Negotiate Them
subtitle: Learn about common dealership fees and how to negotiate them effectively to save money when buying a car. Understand which fees are negotiable and which are not.
content:
Filer? Yep. Just a few more fees and the car is yours.

State and local fees? Yep. Title, tags, registration?

Makes sense. Documentation fee? Nope. That fee just makes up for your low-performing salespeople. But it's illegal for us to remove that.

Correct, but not to negotiate it, so we'll call it a buck.

Nitrogen fee? Nope. I'll get that at Costco.

Reconditioning fee? Nope. That should have been already taken care of by the person from whom you bought the used car.

Destination fee? Already included in the sticker price.

Advertising fee? Also already included in the sticker price.

Market adjustment fee? That's it. I'm going to buy a Tesla online. Dealerships still matter.
